skill.name: gdpr-data-handling
skill.description: Implement GDPR-compliant data handling with consent management, data subject rights, and privacy by design. Use when building systems that process EU personal data, implementing privacy controls, or conducting GDPR compliance reviews.
skill.summary: Implement GDPR-compliant data handling with consent management, data subject rights, and privacy by ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with example code patterns only. No executable scripts, file access, environment access, network calls, or external command execution. All 62 static findings are false positives caused by markdown formatting and documentation text being misidentified as security patterns.

content.value_statement: GDPR requirements are complex and easy to miss during development. This skill provides clear patterns for consent management, data subject rights, and privacy by design to help you build compliant systems.
actual_capabilities: Explains consent data models with audit logging patterns
Shows GDPR-compliant consent banner UI layouts
Outlines DSAR workflows for access, erasure, and portability
Defines data retention policy structures with anonymization options
Describes breach notification steps and 72-hour timelines
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or jurisdiction-specific counsel
Requires integration with your specific data sources and databases
Does not include automated notification or email systems
Does not cover non-GDPR privacy laws in detail

use_cases.title: Plan GDPR scope
use_cases.description: Identify required consent, retention, and DSAR features for a new EU product launch.

use_cases.title: Build DSAR flow
use_cases.description: Implement access, erasure, and portability workflows across multiple data sources.

use_cases.title: Review compliance
use_cases.description: Use the checklist to audit data handling processes and documentation completeness.

prompt_templates.title: Consent basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a GDPR compliant consent capture flow for analytics and marketing with audit logging steps.

prompt_templates.title: DSAR process
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a DSAR access request workflow with verification, deadlines, and data collection steps.

prompt_templates.title: Retention policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose data retention rules for user accounts, support tickets, and analytics with legal bases.

prompt_templates.title: Breach response
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a breach notification plan that meets 72-hour reporting requirements and user notification rules.

output_examples.input: Create a GDPR compliance checklist for a SaaS app handling EU user data.
output: Document the legal basis for each processing purpose
Implement DSAR workflows with 30-day response tracking
Define retention periods with deletion or anonymization

output_examples.input: How should we handle consent withdrawals?
output: Record withdrawal timestamp and source in audit log
Immediately disable data processing for that purpose
Notify downstream systems via event bus
Retain minimal data for legal compliance only

output_examples.input: What data can we keep after account deletion?
output: Transaction records for legal obligation (7 years tax)
Anonymized analytics data with no user linkage
No marketing consent data after withdrawal
Minimal audit logs with hashed identifiers only

best_practices: Map each data field to a documented lawful basis
Log all consent changes with timestamps, sources, and policy versions
Separate PII storage from behavioral data models with encryption
anti_patterns: Bundling consent for unrelated purposes without granular opt-in
Keeping data without a defined retention period or legal basis
Ignoring DSAR verification steps or missing 30-day response deadlines

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides plain text guidance that works across all AI coding platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples only and does not replace professional legal advice.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my stack?
faq.answer: Map the patterns to your data sources and implement the interfaces shown in your code.

faq.question: Does it collect or send any data?
faq.answer: No. It contains static guidance only and does not access files or networks.

faq.question: What if my DSAR workflow fails?
faq.answer: Check identity verification, data source access permissions, and log exceptions for follow up.

faq.question: How does it compare to a legal review?
faq.answer: It complements legal review with implementation guidance but is not a legal substitute.
